when_to_say: When expressing affection or deep feelings towards someone.
example: El amor es lo más importante en la vida. (Love is the most important thing in life.)

when_to_say: When describing someone who is feeling joy or contentment.
example: Estoy muy feliz de verte. (I am very happy to see you.)

when_to_say: When describing the size of an object or thing.
example: La casa es muy grande. (The house is very big.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of eating.
example: Me gusta comer pizza. (I like to eat pizza.)

when_to_say: When referring to someone you share a close friendship with.
example: Juan es mi mejor amigo. (Juan is my best friend.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of working or being employed.
example: Tengo que trabajar mañana. (I have to work tomorrow.)

when_to_say: When referring to the liquid that is essential for life.
example: Necesito beber agua. (I need to drink water.)

when_to_say: When describing something that is recent or has just been made or acquired.
example: Tengo un coche nuevo. (I have a new car.)

when_to_say: When referring to a book or a written work.
example: Estoy leyendo un libro interesante. (I am reading an interesting book.)

when_to_say: When expressing gratitude or appreciation.
example: ¡Muchas gracias por tu ayuda! (Thank you very much for your help!)

when_to_say: When referring to a young person or child.
example: El niño está jugando en el parque. (The child is playing in the park.)

when_to_say: When referring to a group of people related by blood or marriage.
example: Mi familia es muy unida. (My family is very close.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of running or moving quickly on foot.
example: Ella corre todos los días en el parque. (She runs every day in the park.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of waiting or anticipating something.
example: Tengo que esperar el bus. (I have to wait for the bus.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of being alive or residing in a place.
example: Vivo en España. (I live in Spain.)

when_to_say: When describing the color of something.
example: La manzana es roja. (The apple is red.)

when_to_say: When describing something positive or of high quality.
example: La comida está buena. (The food is good.)

when_to_say: When referring to speaking loudly or with force.
example: No grites en la biblioteca. (Don’t shout in the library.)

when_to_say: When referring to the sky above.
example: El cielo está muy azul hoy. (The sky is very blue today.)

when_to_say: When referring to the period of darkness between sunset and sunrise.
example: Me gusta salir por la noche. (I like going out at night.)

when_to_say: When someone is feeling joy or contentment.
example: Estoy muy feliz hoy. (I’m very happy today.)

when_to_say: When describing the size of an object.
example: La casa es grande. (The house is big.)

when_to_say: When referring to a written or printed work.
example: Estoy leyendo un libro muy interesante. (I am reading a very interesting book.)

when_to_say: When referring to a male sibling.
example: Mi hermano es muy inteligente. (My brother is very smart.)

when_to_say: When describing the color of something.
example: La camisa es roja. (The shirt is red.)

when_to_say: When referring to a flat surface used for working, eating, or placing things.
example: La mesa está en el comedor. (The table is in the dining room.)

when_to_say: When referring to a film or movie.
example: Vamos a ver una película esta noche. (We are going to watch a movie tonight.)

when_to_say: When referring to a female friend.
example: Mi amiga Laura es muy simpática. (My friend Laura is very kind.)

when_to_say: When referring to a group of people who are happy.
example: Todos estamos felices con el resultado. (We are all happy with the result.)

when_to_say: When referring to an automobile or car.
example: Mi coche está en el garaje. (My car is in the garage.)

when_to_say: When describing the color red.
example: El balón es rojo. (The ball is red.)

when_to_say: When referring to a star, either celestial or famous.
example: La estrella brilló toda la noche. (The star shone all night.)

when_to_say: When referring to a small, solid, natural mineral.
example: Encontré una piedra en el camino. (I found a stone on the path.)

when_to_say: When referring to a window in a building or vehicle.
example: Abre la ventana, por favor. (Open the window, please.)

when_to_say: When referring to a reflective surface.
example: Mírate en el espejo. (Look at yourself in the mirror.)

when_to_say: When referring to a female friend.
example: María es mi amiga. (Maria is my friend.)

when_to_say: When referring to light or illumination.
example: La luz está apagada. (The light is off.)

when_to_say: When referring to bread, the food.
example: Me gusta comer pan con mantequilla. (I like to eat bread with butter.)

when_to_say: When referring to any edible fruit from plants.
example: La fruta está en la mesa. (The fruit is on the table.)

when_to_say: When referring to music or sounds created by instruments.
example: Me encanta escuchar música. (I love listening to music.)

when_to_say: When referring to a telephone or mobile phone.
example: ¿Tienes un teléfono móvil? (Do you have a mobile phone?)

when_to_say: When referring to a dog.
example: Mi perro es muy cariñoso. (My dog is very affectionate.)

when_to_say: When referring to a cat.
example: El gato está durmiendo. (The cat is sleeping.)

when_to_say: When referring to a tree.
example: El árbol tiene muchas hojas. (The tree has many leaves.)

when_to_say: When describing something as red in color.
example: El coche es rojo. (The car is red.)

when_to_say: When referring to the summer season.
example: Me encanta ir a la playa en verano. (I love going to the beach in summer.)

when_to_say: When referring to the winter season.
example: En invierno hace mucho frío. (It’s very cold in winter.)

when_to_say: When referring to the spring season.
example: Las flores crecen en primavera. (The flowers bloom in spring.)

when_to_say: When referring to the autumn season.
example: En otoño las hojas caen. (In autumn, the leaves fall.)

when_to_say: When referring to a place where books are kept for reading or borrowing.
example: Voy a la biblioteca a estudiar. (I go to the library to study.)

when_to_say: When referring to an educational institution.
example: Los niños van a la escuela cada mañana. (The children go to school every morning.)

when_to_say: When referring to a higher education institution.
example: Quiero estudiar en la universidad. (I want to study at the university.)

when_to_say: When referring to employment or tasks.
example: Tengo mucho trabajo esta semana. (I have a lot of work this week.)

when_to_say: When referring to a personal computer.
example: Uso la computadora para trabajar. (I use the computer for work.)

when_to_say: When referring to footwear.
example: Me gustan tus zapatos. (I like your shoes.)

when_to_say: When referring to a shirt or top.
example: Mi camisa es de color azul. (My shirt is blue.)

when_to_say: When referring to pants or trousers.
example: Llevo pantalones negros. (I am wearing black pants.)

when_to_say: When referring to a hat or head covering.
example: El sombrero me queda bien. (The hat looks good on me.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of writing.
example: Me gusta escribir cartas. (I like writing letters.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of reading.
example: Leo un libro cada semana. (I read a book every week.)

when_to_say: When referring to speaking or talking.
example: Me gusta hablar con mis amigos. (I like talking with my friends.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of listening to something.
example: Estoy escuchando música. (I am listening to music.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of seeing or perceiving with the eyes.
example: Puedo ver la televisión. (I can watch television.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of thinking or considering.
example: Tengo que pensar en mi futuro. (I need to think about my future.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of buying something.
example: Voy a comprar una casa. (I am going to buy a house.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of selling something.
example: Ellos venden frutas en el mercado. (They sell fruits at the market.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of walking or moving on foot.
example: Vamos a andar por el parque. (We are going to walk through the park.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of dancing.
example: Me encanta bailar salsa. (I love dancing salsa.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of singing.
example: Ella canta muy bien. (She sings very well.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of traveling from one place to another.
example: Voy a viajar a España. (I am going to travel to Spain.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of studying or learning.
example: Estudio para los exámenes. (I study for the exams.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of working.
example: Trabajo en una oficina. (I work in an office.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of shedding tears due to emotion.
example: El niño comenzó a llorar. (The child started to cry.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of laughing.
example: Me hace reír mucho. (He/she makes me laugh a lot.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of eating food.
example: Voy a comer pizza. (I am going to eat pizza.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of drinking.
example: Quiero beber agua. (I want to drink water.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of running.
example: Me gusta correr por la mañana. (I like to run in the morning.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of walking.
example: Siempre camino al trabajo. (I always walk to work.)

when_to_say: When referring to the action of jumping.
example: Los niños están saltando en el jardín. (The kids are jumping in the garden.)

when_to_say: When describing someone who works hard.
example: Es una persona muy trabajadora. (He/she is a very hardworking person.)

when_to_say: When describing someone as friendly or nice.
example: La señora es muy amable. (The lady is very kind.)

when_to_say: When describing someone as smart or bright.
example: Es un estudiante muy inteligente. (He/she is a very intelligent student.)

when_to_say: When describing something as beautiful.
example: La vista es hermosa. (The view is beautiful.)

when_to_say: When referring to something that is newly made or recently bought.
example: Tengo un coche nuevo. (I have a new car.)

when_to_say: When referring to something that is aged or not new.
example: Este libro es muy viejo. (This book is very old.)

when_to_say: When describing the size of something.
example: La casa es grande. (The house is big.)

when_to_say: When describing something as small in size.
example: El perro es pequeño. (The dog is small.)

when_to_say: When describing something as moving or happening at a slow pace.
example: El coche es lento. (The car is slow.)

when_to_say: When describing something as moving or happening quickly.
example: El avión vuela rápido. (The airplane flies fast.)

when_to_say: When describing something as low in cost or price.
example: Este teléfono es barato. (This phone is cheap.)

when_to_say: When describing something as costly or high in price.
example: El reloj es caro. (The watch is expensive.)

when_to_say: When describing something that is easy to do or understand.
example: El examen fue fácil. (The exam was easy.)

when_to_say: When describing something that is hard to do or understand.
example: Este problema es difícil. (This problem is difficult.)

when_to_say: When describing someone or something as happy or joyful.
example: Estoy muy feliz hoy. (I am very happy today.)

when_to_say: When describing someone or something as sad or sorrowful.
example: Ella está triste porque se perdió su perro. (She is sad because she lost her dog.)

when_to_say: When describing someone as angry or upset.
example: Está enojado con su amigo. (He is angry with his friend.)

when_to_say: When describing someone as scared or fearful.
example: El niño es miedoso de la oscuridad. (The child is scared of the dark.)

when_to_say: When describing someone as brave or courageous.
example: El soldado fue muy valiente. (The soldier was very brave.)

when_to_say: When describing someone or something as calm or peaceful.
example: La playa está tranquila. (The beach is peaceful.)

when_to_say: When describing something as dangerous or risky.
example: El perro es peligroso. (The dog is dangerous.)

when_to_say: When describing someone or something as healthy.
example: Una dieta sana es importante. (A healthy diet is important.)

when_to_say: When describing something as rich in flavor or wealth.
example: La comida está rica. (The food is delicious.)

when_to_say: When describing someone or something as lacking money or resources.
example: El hombre es pobre pero feliz. (The man is poor but happy.)

when_to_say: When describing food as tasting very good.
example: El pastel está delicioso. (The cake is delicious.)

when_to_say: When describing something as fresh or newly made.
example: La fruta está fresca. (The fruit is fresh.)

when_to_say: When describing something as hot in temperature.
example: El café está caliente. (The coffee is hot.)

when_to_say: When describing something as cold in temperature.
example: Hace frío hoy. (It is cold today.)

when_to_say: When referring to a large amount of something feminine.
example: Tengo mucha hambre. (I am very hungry.)

when_to_say: When referring to a large amount of something masculine.
example: Hay mucho trabajo. (There is a lot of work.)

when_to_say: When referring to a small amount of something.
example: Tengo poco tiempo. (I have little time.)

when_to_say: When comparing amounts and referring to less of something.
example: Tengo menos dinero que tú. (I have less money than you.)

when_to_say: When referring to a greater amount of something.
example: Quiero más comida. (I want more food.)

when_to_say: When comparing something to express that it is superior or of higher quality.
example: Este libro es mejor que ese. (This book is better than that one.)

when_to_say: When comparing something to express that it is inferior or of lower quality.
example: El clima está peor hoy. (The weather is worse today.)

when_to_say: When referring to something being the same or equal to another.
example: Las dos respuestas son iguales. (Both answers are the same.)

when_to_say: When referring to something being distinct or unlike something else.
example: Tienen opiniones diferentes. (They have different opinions.)

when_to_say: When referring to the first in a sequence or order.
example: Él llegó primero. (He arrived first.)

when_to_say: When referring to the last in a sequence or order.
example: El último día fue muy divertido. (The last day was very fun.)

when_to_say: When referring to the second in a sequence or order.
example: El segundo libro es mejor. (The second book is better.)

when_to_say: When referring to the third in a sequence or order.
example: El tercer capítulo es el más interesante. (The third chapter is the most interesting.)

when_to_say: When referring to the day before the present one.
example: Ayer fue un día muy largo. (Yesterday was a very long day.)

when_to_say: When referring to the current day.
example: Hoy tengo una reunión importante. (Today I have an important meeting.)

when_to_say: When referring to the day after the current one.
example: Mañana iré al cine. (Tomorrow I will go to the cinema.)

when_to_say: When referring to something that happens all the time.
example: Siempre desayuno a las 7. (I always have breakfast at 7.)

when_to_say: When referring to something that does not happen at any time.
example: Nunca he estado en Francia. (I have never been to France.)

when_to_say: When referring to something that happens occasionally.
example: A veces me gusta ir al parque. (Sometimes I like to go to the park.)

when_to_say: When referring to something that nearly happens but not completely.
example: Casi llegamos a tiempo. (We almost arrived on time.)

when_to_say: When emphasizing the degree of something.
example: Esta película es muy interesante. (This movie is very interesting.)

when_to_say: When referring to a small quantity of something.
example: Tengo poco dinero. (I have little money.)

when_to_say: When referring to an excess amount of something.
example: Comí demasiado. (I ate too much.)

when_to_say: When referring to the current location.
example: Estoy aquí. (I am here.)

when_to_say: When referring to a place that is farther away.
example: La tienda está allí. (The store is there.)

when_to_say: When referring to something that is far away.
example: La estación está muy lejos. (The station is very far.)

when_to_say: When referring to something that is near or close.
example: La tienda está cerca de aquí. (The store is close to here.)

example: Me gusta caminar en el parque. (I like to walk in the park.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of running.
example: Corro todos los días. (I run every day.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of jumping.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of writing.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of reading.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of listening.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of seeing.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of looking at something.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of dancing.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of cooking.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of eating.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of drinking.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of sleeping.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of teaching.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of learning.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of playing.

when_to_say: When referring to completing something.
example: Acabé mi tarea. (I finished my homework.)

example: Voy a empezar a estudiar. (I am going to start studying.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of waiting or having expectations.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of working.
example: Trabajo en un hospital. (I work in a hospital.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of traveling.
example: Voy a viajar a España el próximo mes. (I am going to travel to Spain next month.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of arriving at a location.

when_to_say: When referring to the act of returning to a place.
example: Voy a volver mañana. (I will return tomorrow.)

when_to_say: When referring to the act of feeling or experiencing emotions.

when_to_say: When referring to possession or obligation.

example: Mi familia es grande. (My family is big.)

when_to_say: When referring to a close companion or friend.
example: Mi amigo vive cerca. (My friend lives nearby.)

when_to_say: When referring to a group of people.
example: Hay mucha gente en el parque. (There are many people in the park.)

when_to_say: When referring to a young child or boy.
example: El niño juega en el jardín. (The boy plays in the garden.)

example: Mi padre es muy simpático. (My father is very nice.)

when_to_say: When referring to a mother.
example: Mi madre cocina muy bien. (My mother cooks very well.)

when_to_say: When referring to a brother.
example: Tengo un hermano mayor. (I have an older brother.)

when_to_say: When referring to a sister.
example: Mi hermana es muy amable. (My sister is very kind.)

when_to_say: When referring to a grandfather.
example: Mi abuelo tiene 80 años. (My grandfather is 80 years old.)

when_to_say: When referring to a grandmother.
example: La abuela de Juan es muy cariñosa. (Juan's grandmother is very affectionate.)

when_to_say: When referring to an uncle.
example: Mi tío vive en Barcelona. (My uncle lives in Barcelona.)

example: Mi tía es profesora. (My aunt is a teacher.)

when_to_say: When referring to a group of friends.
example: Salgo con mis amigos el viernes. (I go out with my friends on Friday.)

when_to_say: When referring to a school (elementary or high school).
example: Mis hijos van al colegio cerca de casa. (My children go to school near our house.)

when_to_say: When referring to a university or higher education institution.

when_to_say: When referring to one's occupation or professional duties.
example: Tengo un trabajo en una oficina. (I have a job in an office.)

when_to_say: When referring to a holiday or vacation.
example: Me voy de vacaciones a la playa. (I’m going on vacation to the beach.)

when_to_say: When referring to a celebration or social event.
example: Vamos a una fiesta este fin de semana. (We’re going to a party this weekend.)

when_to_say: When referring to food or a meal.
example: La comida está lista. (The food is ready.)

when_to_say: When referring to a drink or beverage.

when_to_say: When referring to bread, a staple food.
